results.title: Aucassin and Nicolette
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated medieval fantasy, a delightful silhouette film, with colour background by master German animator Lotte Reiniger. Set against a background of castles and forest with Renaissance style music this enchanting tale recounts the love story of Aucassin and Nicolette.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lotte Reiniger, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Atomic energy explained
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: A practical outline of atomic energy and its peaceful applications. Studies the structure of atomic particles and shows how energy can be released from them to produce atomic power. Also illustrates how radio-isotopes are being put to valuable use in modern industry and medicine. No other credits available.

results.title: At whose door
results.creator_credit: Max Anderson, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of accident prevention in the British iron and steel industry. Demonstrates that accidents do not merely happen- they are caused, not always by one individual or one mistake but by a combination of circumstances which could have been foreseen. Illustrations include: faulty handling of materials or tools, falling or knocking against equipment, untidy workshops, bad stacking or storing, neglect and carelessness.

results.title: Assignment P.6.
results.brief_description: An account the evolution of the Rover Company’s P.6. car - later known as the Rover 2000 - from the initial plans to the first production line models three years later. No other credits available.

results.title: An Asset from the past
results.brief_description: It is said of Origami ‘the thing to be enjoyed is not the material itself but the variation that comes from using it efficiently.’ This can be said of Japanese industry, in which concentrated efforts have been made to achieve more efficiency and greater economy through systematization. Examples of Japanese systems are many and varied; from the tea making ceremony to traditional and modern architectural innovations; from fan and doll making to ship construction. No other credits available.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about pedestrians [Spanish version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: The numerous hazards facing a pedestrian in a busy Australian city are pointed out. The importance of observing signals, crossing on pedestrian overpasses or crosswalks, and carefully watching traffic are emphasised. Note: In Spanish.
